remarks.format: ## Remarks 完成对调用。 completes a call to . 方法阻止，直至断开连接完成。The method blocks until the disconnect completes. 有关异步操作的信息，请参阅 MSDN 库中的异步编程的概述主题。For information about asynchronous operations, see the Asynchronous Programming Overview topic in the MSDN library. > [!NOTE] > 如果你收到，使用属性来获取特定的错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后，请参阅 Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码文档 MSDN 库中的有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the Windows Sockets version 2 API error code documentation in the MSDN library for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[在.NET Framework 中进行网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例创建套接字进行异步通信，并将一些数据发送到远程主机。The following code example creates a socket for asynchronous communication and sends some data to a remote host. 当数据已发送时，调用以停止发送和接收活动。When the data has been sent, is called to stop the send and receive activity. 然后调用以开始断开连接请求。Then is called to begin a disconnect request. 回调委托调用来结束异步请求。The callback delegate calls to end the asynchronous request. 完成请求后，属性将查询以测试是否断开连接的套接字。When the request completes, the property is queried to test whether the socket is disconnected. [!code-cpp[Nclsocketenhancements#11](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLSocketEnhancements/CPP/nclsocketenhancements.cpp#11)] [!code-csharp[Nclsocketenhancements#11](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLSocketEnhancements/CS/nclsocketenhancements.cs#11)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法完成异步读取的操作以启动方法。The method completes the asynchronous read operation started in the method. 之前调用，你需要创建实现一个回调方法委托。Before calling , you need to create a callback method that implements the delegate. 此回调方法在一个单独的线程中执行之后, 由系统调用返回。This callback method executes in a separate thread and is called by the system after returns. 回调方法必须接受返回作为参数的方法。The callback method must accept the returned by the method as a parameter. 在回调方法中，调用方法以获取状态对象传递给方法。Within the callback method, call the method of the to obtain the state object passed to the method. 提取接收从此状态对象。Extract the receiving from this state object. 获取之后，可以调用方法已成功完成读取的操作，并返回读取的字节数。After obtaining the , you can call the method to successfully complete the read operation and return the number of bytes read. 方法将一直阻止到的数据是否可用。The method will block until data is available. 如果你使用的是无连接协议，将读取传入的网络缓冲区中可用的第一个排队数据报。If you are using a connectionless protocol, will read the first enqueued datagram available in the incoming network buffer. 如果你使用的一种面向连接的协议，方法将读取多的数据可用最中指定的字节数多`size`参数方法。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, the method will read as much data as is available up to the number of bytes you specified in the `size` parameter of the method. 如果远程主机关闭与连接收到方法，并且所有可用数据，方法将立即完成并返回零字节。If the remote host shuts down the connection with the method, and all available data has been received, the method will complete immediately and return zero bytes. 若要获取已接收的数据，请调用方法，然后提取生成的状态对象中包含的缓冲区。To obtain the received data, call the method of the , and extract the buffer contained in the resulting state object. 若要取消挂起，调用方法。To cancel a pending , call the method. > [!NOTE] > 如果你收到，使用属性来获取特定的错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后，请参阅 Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码文档 MSDN 库中的有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the Windows Sockets version 2 API error code documentation in the MSDN library for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 在线程退出时，由给定线程启动的所有 i/o 操作已取消。All I/O initiated by a given thread is canceled when that thread exits. 如果在线程退出操作完成前，挂起的异步操作可能会失败。A pending asynchronous operation can fail if the thread exits before the operation completes. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[在.NET Framework 中进行网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例结束挂起的异步读取。The following code example ends a pending asynchronous read. 有关完整示例，演示与套接字的异步通信的说明，请参阅[套接字的代码示例](~/docs/framework/network-programming/socket-code-examples.md)。For a complete example that demonstrates asynchronous communications with sockets, see [Socket Code Examples](~/docs/framework/network-programming/socket-code-examples.md). remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法完成异步读取的操作以启动方法。The method completes the asynchronous read operation started in the method. 之前调用，你需要创建实现一个回调方法委托。Before calling , you need to create a callback method that implements the delegate. 此回调方法在一个单独的线程中执行之后, 由系统调用返回。This callback method executes in a separate thread and is called by the system after returns. 回调方法必须接受返回作为参数的方法。The callback method must accept the returned by the method as a parameter. 在回调方法中，调用方法以获取状态对象传递给方法。Within the callback method, call the method of the to obtain the state object passed to the method. 提取接收从此状态对象。Extract the receiving from this state object. 获取之后，可以调用方法已成功完成读取的操作，并返回读取的字节数。After obtaining the , you can call the method to successfully complete the read operation and return the number of bytes read. 方法将一直阻止到的数据是否可用。The method will block until data is available. 如果你使用的是无连接协议，将读取传入的网络缓冲区中可用的第一个排队数据报。If you are using a connectionless protocol, will read the first enqueued datagram available in the incoming network buffer. 如果你使用的一种面向连接的协议，方法将读取多的数据可用最中指定的字节数多`size`参数方法。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, the method will read as much data as is available up to the number of bytes you specified in the `size` parameter of the method. 如果远程主机关闭与连接收到方法，并且所有可用数据，方法将立即完成并返回零字节。If the remote host shuts down the connection with the method, and all available data has been received, the method will complete immediately and return zero bytes. 若要获取已接收的数据，请调用方法对象，然后提取生成的状态对象中包含的缓冲区。To obtain the received data, call the method of the object, and extract the buffer contained in the resulting state object. 若要标识原始主机，提取和将其转换为。To identify the originating host, extract the and cast it to an . 使用方法来获取的 IP 地址和方法来获取端口号。Use the method to obtain the IP address and the method to obtain the port number. > [!NOTE] > 如果你收到，使用属性来获取特定的错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后，请参阅 Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码文档 MSDN 库中的有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the Windows Sockets version 2 API error code documentation in the MSDN library for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[在.NET Framework 中进行网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例结束挂起的异步读取从特定。The following code example ends a pending asynchronous read from a specific . [!code-cpp[Socket_Async_Send_Receive#10](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Socket_Async_Send_Receive/CPP/source.cpp#10)] [!code-csharp[Socket_Async_Send_Receive#10](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Socket_Async_Send_Receive/CS/source.cs#10)] [!code-vb[Socket_Async_Send_Receive#10](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Socket_Async_Send_Receive/VB/source.vb#10)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 完成异步发送操作以启动。 completes the asynchronous send operation started in . 之前调用，你需要创建实现一个回调方法委托。Before calling , you need to create a callback method that implements the delegate. 此回调方法在一个单独的线程中执行之后, 由系统调用返回。This callback method executes in a separate thread and is called by the system after returns. 回调方法必须接受返回作为参数的方法。The callback method must accept the returned by the method as a parameter. 在回调方法中，调用方法参数来获取发送。Within the callback method, call the method of the parameter to obtain the sending . 获取之后，可以调用方法已成功完成发送操作并返回发送的字节数。After obtaining the , you can call the method to successfully complete the send operation and return the number of bytes sent. 如果你使用的是无连接协议，将阻止，直到发送数据报。If you are using a connectionless protocol, will block until the datagram is sent. 如果你使用的一种面向连接的协议，将阻止，直到一些缓冲区已发送。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, will block until some of the buffer was sent. 如果返回值从指示缓冲区不完全发送，调用方法再次，修改要保存未发送的数据的缓冲区。If the return value from indicates that the buffer was not completely sent, call the method again, modifying the buffer to hold the unsent data. 就你发送的数据将立即显示在网络不能保证。There is no guarantee that the data you send will appear on the network immediately. 若要增加网络效率，基础系统可能会延迟传输，直到收集了大量传出数据。To increase network efficiency, the underlying system may delay transmission until a significant amount of outgoing data is collected. 成功完成后方法意味着基础系统有空间来你的数据的网络发送的缓冲区。A successful completion of the method means that the underlying system has had room to buffer your data for a network send. > [!NOTE] > 如果你收到，使用属性来获取特定的错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后，请参阅 Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码文档 MSDN 库中的有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the Windows Sockets version 2 API error code documentation in the MSDN library for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 在线程退出时，由给定线程启动的所有 i/o 操作已取消。All I/O initiated by a given thread is canceled when that thread exits. 如果在线程退出操作完成前，挂起的异步操作可能会失败。A pending asynchronous operation can fail if the thread exits before the operation completes. > [!NOTE] > 成功完成后发送不指示已成功传递数据。The successful completion of a send does not indicate that the data was successfully delivered. 如果没有缓冲区空间以容纳要传输的数据传输系统中可用，除非套接字置于阻止模式下，将阻止发送。If no buffer space is available within the transport system to hold the data to be transmitted, send will block unless the socket has been placed in nonblocking mode. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[在.NET Framework 中进行网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例结束挂起的异步发送。The following code example ends a pending asynchronous send. [!code-cpp[Socket_Async_Send_Receive#6](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Socket_Async_Send_Receive/CPP/source.cpp#6)] [!code-csharp[Socket_Async_Send_Receive#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Socket_Async_Send_Receive/CS/source.cs#6)] [!code-vb[Socket_Async_Send_Receive#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Socket_Async_Send_Receive/VB/source.vb#6)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 完成异步发送操作以启动。 completes the asynchronous send operation started in . 之前调用，你必须创建实现一个回调方法委托。Before calling , you must create a callback method that implements the delegate. 此回调方法在一个单独的线程中执行之后, 由系统调用返回。This callback method executes in a separate thread and is called by the system after returns. 回调方法必须接受返回对象作为参数的方法。The callback method must accept the object returned by the method as a parameter. 在回调方法中，调用方法参数来获取发送。Within the callback method, call the method of the parameter to obtain the sending . 获取之后，可以调用方法才能成功完成发送操作。After obtaining the , you can call the method to successfully complete the send operation. 如果你使用的是无连接协议，一直阻塞，直到发送数据报。If you are using a connectionless protocol, blocks until the datagram is sent. 如果你使用的一种面向连接的协议，一直阻塞，直到发送整个文件。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, blocks until the entire file is sent. 就你发送的数据将立即显示在网络不能保证。There is no guarantee that the data you send will appear on the network immediately. 若要增加网络效率，基础系统可能会延迟传输，直到收集了大量传出数据。To increase network efficiency, the underlying system may delay transmission until a significant amount of outgoing data is collected. 成功完成后方法意味着基础系统有空间来你的数据的网络发送的缓冲区。A successful completion of the method means that the underlying system has had room to buffer your data for a network send. > [!NOTE] > 如果你收到，使用属性来获取特定的错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后，请参阅 Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码文档 MSDN 库中的有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the Windows Sockets version 2 API error code documentation in the MSDN library for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[在.NET Framework 中进行网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## span.span: The default is for Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP Service Pack 2, and for all other versions.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果是`false`，可以使用多个套接字方法将绑定到特定端口; 但是只有一个套接字可以执行对发送到端口的网络流量的操作。If is `false`, multiple sockets can use the method to bind to a specific port; however only one of the sockets can perform operations on the network traffic sent to the port. 如果尝试使用多个套接字方法来绑定到特定端口，则具有更具体的 IP 地址将处理发送到该端口的网络流量。If more than one socket attempts to use the method to bind to a particular port, then the one with the more specific IP address will handle the network traffic sent to that port. 如果是`true`，第一次使用方法来尝试将绑定到特定端口，而不考虑 Internet 协议 (IP) 地址，将会成功; 的所有后续使用方法来尝试将绑定到该端口将之前销毁原始绑定套接字失败。If is `true`, the first use of the method to attempt to bind to a particular port, regardless of Internet Protocol (IP) address, will succeed; all subsequent uses of the method to attempt to bind to that port will fail until the original bound socket is destroyed. 此属性必须之前设置调用; 否则为将引发。This property must be set before is called; otherwise an will be thrown. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何将属性。The following code example demonstrates the use of the property. remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果显式将其绑定通过调用，套接字将被视为绑定到的本地端口方法，或通过调用成员等隐式绑定， ，或，此过程使用临时的本地端口 （免费端口大于1024，选择的操作系统。)服务器使用方法，以便客户端可能会连接到它们将绑定到的已知端口。A socket is considered bound to a local port if it is explicitly bound by calling the method, or implicitly bound by calling members like , , or , which use an ephemeral local port (a free port greater than 1024, selected by the operating system.) Servers use the method to bind to a well-known port so that clients may connect to them. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何将属性。The following code example demonstrates the use of the property. value.span: A ，它指定如何关闭套接字时逗留。

span.span: A that specifies how to linger while closing a socket.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性用于更改方式方法的行为。The property changes the way method behaves. 当组修改在其下连接可以重置通过 Winsock 的条件时，此属性。This property when set modifies the conditions under which the connection can be reset by Winsock. 连接重置仍会发生根据 IP 协议行为。Connection resets can still occur based on the IP protocol behavior. 此属性控制的面向连接的连接到在调用后将保持打开的时间长度仍然要发送数据时。This property controls the length of time that a connection-oriented connection will remain open after a call to when data remains to be sent. 在调用方法来向对等节点发送数据时，此数据将被置于传出的网络缓冲区。When you call methods to send data to a peer, this data is placed in the outgoing network buffer. 此属性可以用于确保将此数据发送到远程主机之前方法删除连接。This property can be used to ensure that this data is sent to the remote host before the method drops the connection. 若要启用延迟，创建实例包含所需的值，并设置指向此实例的属性。To enable lingering, create a instance containing the desired values, and set the property to this instance. 下表描述的行为输入的可能的值的方法属性和属性存储在属性。The following table describes the behavior of the method for the possible values of the property and the property stored in the property. |LingerState.EnabledLingerState.Enabled|LingerState.LingerTimeLingerState.LingerTime|行为Behavior| |-------------------------|----------------------------|--------------| |`false` （禁用），默认值`false` (disabled), the default value|超时不适用，（默认值）。The time-out is not applicable, (default).|尝试发送数据挂起，直到默认 IP 协议超时时间已到。Attempts to send pending data until the default IP protocol time-out expires.| |`true` （已启用）`true` (enabled)|非零的超时A nonzero time-out|尝试发送挂起的数据，直到指定的超时时间已到，如果尝试失败，然后 Winsock 重置连接。Attempts to send pending data until the specified time-out expires, and if the attempt fails, then Winsock resets the connection.| |`true` （已启用）`true` (enabled)|零超时。A zero timeout.|丢弃所有挂起的数据。Discards any pending data. 对于面向连接的套接字 (例如 TCP)，Winsock 重置连接。For connection-oriented socket (TCP, for example), Winsock resets the connection.| IP 堆栈计算默认 IP 协议超时期限为使用基于连接的往返时间。The IP stack computes the default IP protocol time-out period to use based on the round trip time of the connection. 在大多数情况下，该堆栈计算的该超时是个应用程序定义更具相关性。In most cases, the time-out computed by the stack is more relevant than one defined by an application. 这是一个套接字的默认行为时未设置属性。This is the default behavior for a socket when the property is not set. 当属性存储在属性设置大于默认 IP 协议超时值，则仍将应用和重写的默认 IP 协议超时时间。When the property stored in the property is set greater than the default IP protocol time-out, the default IP protocol time-out will still apply and override. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何将属性。The following code example demonstrates the use of the property. remarks.format: ## Remarks 导致一个面向连接的侦听传入的连接尝试。 causes a connection-oriented to listen for incoming connection attempts. `backlog`参数指定可排队等待接受的传入连接数。The `backlog` parameter specifies the number of incoming connections that can be queued for acceptance. 若要确定的最大可以指定的连接数，检索值。To determine the maximum number of connections you can specify, retrieve the value. 不会阻止。 does not block. 如果你收到，使用属性来获取特定的错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后，请参阅 Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码文档 MSDN 库中的有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the Windows Sockets version 2 API error code documentation in the MSDN library for a detailed description of the error. 使用或以接受来自队列的连接。Use or to accept a connection from the queue. > [!NOTE] > 必须调用方法之前调用，或将引发。You must call the method before calling , or will throw a . > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[在.NET Framework 中进行网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). > [!NOTE] > 积压工作参数仅限于具体取决于操作系统的不同值。The backlog parameter is limited to different values depending on the Operating System. 你可以指定更高的值，但积压工作将会受到某些限制的基于操作系统。You may specify a higher value, but the backlog will be limited based on the Operating System. ## Examples 下面的代码示例使用来侦听传入连接。The following code example uses to listen for incoming connections. remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性可以获取包含到的本地 IP 地址和端口号你绑定。The property gets an that contains the local IP address and port number to which your is bound. 您必须将此转换到之前检索的任何信息。You must cast this to an before retrieving any information. 然后，你可以调用方法来检索本地，和方法来检索其中的本地端口号。You can then call the method to retrieve the local , and the method to retrieve the local port number. 属性通常设置进行的调用之后方法。The property is usually set after you make a call to the method. 如果你允许系统分配套接字的本地 IP 地址和端口号，属性将设置后第一次的 I/O 操作。If you allow the system to assign your socket's local IP address and port number, the property will be set after the first I/O operation. 对于面向连接的协议，第一次的 I/O 操作将是调用或方法。For connection-oriented protocols, the first I/O operation would be a call to the or method. 对于无连接协议，第一次的 I/O 操作是任何发送或接收调用。For connectionless protocols, the first I/O operation would be any of the send or receive calls. > [!NOTE] > 如果你收到，使用属性来获取特定的错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后，请参阅 Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码文档 MSDN 库中的有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the Windows Sockets version 2 API error code documentation in the MSDN library for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[在.NET Framework 中进行网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例检索并显示本地和远程终结点。The following code example retrieves and displays the local and remote endpoints. span.span: if the receives outgoing multicast packets; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 多路广播是用于在 Internet 上的多对多通信的可扩展方法。Multicast is a scalable method for many-to-many communication on the Internet. 进程订阅到多播地址;然后，由订阅进程发送任何数据包接收订阅的多播地址的每个其他进程。A process subscribes to a multicast address; then, any packets sent by a subscribed process are received by every other process subscribed to the multicast address. 传输控制协议 (TCP) 套接字上设置此属性将产生任何影响。Setting this property on a Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) socket will have no effect. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何将属性。The following code example demonstrates the use of the property. summary.span: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the stream is using the Nagle algorithm.

value.span: 如果使用 Nagle 算法; 否则为。

span.span: if the uses the Nagle algorithm; otherwise, .

value.span: 默认值为 。

span.span: The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Nagle 算法旨在导致套接字缓冲小数据包，然后合并并将其发送在某些情况下的一个数据包中，从而减少网络流量。The Nagle algorithm is designed to reduce network traffic by causing the socket to buffer small packets and then combine and send them in one packet under certain circumstances. TCP 数据包包含 40 个字节的标头以及所发送的数据。A TCP packet consists of 40 bytes of header plus the data being sent. 当与 TCP 发送的数据的小数据包时，TCP 标头导致开销可能会的网络流量的重要部分。使高负荷在网络上，这种开销导致拥塞可能导致丢失数据报和重新传输数，以及导致阻塞过多的传播时间。When small packets of data are sent with TCP, the overhead resulting from the TCP header can become a significant part of the network traffic.On heavily loaded networks, the congestion resulting from this overhead can result in lost datagrams and retransmissions, as well as excessive propagation time caused by congestion. Nagle 算法抑制发送的新 TCP segmentswhen 新传出数据到达从用户中，如果在连接上的任何处数据将保留未确认。The Nagle algorithm inhibits the sending of new TCP segmentswhen new outgoing data arrives from the user if any previouslytransmitted data on the connection remains unacknowledged. 大多数网络应用程序应使用 Nagle 算法。The majority of network applications should use the Nagle algorithm. 用户数据报协议 (UDP) 套接字上设置此属性将产生任何影响。Setting this property on a User Datagram Protocol (UDP) socket will have no effect. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何将属性。The following code example demonstrates the use of the property. [!code-cpp[SocketPropertyTester#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SocketPropertyTester/CPP/class1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[SocketPropertyTester#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SocketPropertyTester/CS/class1.cs#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法将检查的状态。The method will check the state of the . 指定为`selectMode`参数，以确定如果是可读。Specify for the `selectMode` parameter to determine if the is readable. 指定以确定是否是可写。Specify to determine if the is writable. 使用来检测错误条件。Use to detect an error condition. 将阻止执行，直到指定的时间段，以测量`microseconds`，间隔。 will block execution until the specified time period, measured in `microseconds`, elapses. 设置`microSeconds`参数为负的整数，如果你想要无限期地等待响应。Set the `microSeconds` parameter to a negative integer if you would like to wait indefinitely for a response. 如果你想要检查多个套接字的状态，你可能希望使用方法。If you want to check the status of multiple sockets, you might prefer to use the method. > [!NOTE] > 如果你收到，使用属性来获取特定的错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后，请参阅 Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码文档 MSDN 库中的有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the Windows Sockets version 2 API error code documentation in the MSDN library for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 此方法无法检测到某些类型的连接问题，如网络电缆中断，或远程主机已意外关闭。This method cannot detect certain kinds of connection problems, such as a broken network cable, or that the remote host was shut down ungracefully. 你必须尝试发送或接收数据，以检测这些类型的错误。You must attempt to send or receive data to detect these kinds of errors. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[在.NET Framework 中进行网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例创建套接字，连接到服务器，并使用若要检查的套接字的状态。The following code example creates a socket, connects to a server, and uses to check the status of the socket. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法将数据读入的缓冲区参数并返回成功读取的字节数。The method reads data into the buffer parameter and returns the number of bytes successfully read. 你可以调用从面向连接的和无连接的套接字。You can call from both connection-oriented and connectionless sockets. 此重载仅要求你提供接收缓冲区。This overload only requires you to provide a receive buffer. 缓冲区偏移量的默认值为 0，默认大小为缓冲区参数的长度和值默认为。The buffer offset defaults to 0, the size defaults to the length of the buffer parameter, and the value defaults to . 如果你使用的一个面向连接的协议，则必须调用建立远程主机的连接，或接受之前调用的传入连接。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, you must either call to establish a remote host connection, or to accept an incoming connection prior to calling . 方法将仅读取数据中建立的远程主机从到达或方法。The method will only read data that arrives from the remote host established in the or method. 如果你使用的是无连接协议，你还可以使用方法。If you are using a connectionless protocol, you can also use the method. 将可以接收来自任何主机的数据。 will allow you to receive data arriving from any host. 如果没有数据可供读取，方法将阻塞，直到数据不可用，除非通过使用设置超时值。If no data is available for reading, the method will block until data is available, unless a time-out value was set by using . 如果超出了超时值，调用将引发。If the time-out value was exceeded, the call will throw a . 如果你是在非阻塞模式下，并且没有中可用的数据在协议堆栈缓冲区中方法将立即完成并引发。If you are in non-blocking mode, and there is no data available in the in the protocol stack buffer, the method will complete immediately and throw a . 你可以使用属性来确定是否可供读取数据。You can use the property to determine if data is available for reading. 当为非零，重试该接收操作。When is non-zero, retry the receive operation. 如果使用的一个面向连接的、方法将读取多的数据可用，直到达到的缓冲区的大小。If you are using a connection-oriented , the method will read as much data as is available, up to the size of the buffer. 如果远程主机关闭与连接收到方法，并且所有可用数据，方法将立即完成并返回零字节。If the remote host shuts down the connection with the method, and all available data has been received, the method will complete immediately and return zero bytes. 如果你使用的是无连接，将从你在中指定的目标地址中读取第一个排队数据报方法。If you are using a connectionless , will read the first queued datagram from the destination address you specify in the method. 如果你收到的数据报大于的大小`buffer`参数，`buffer`被填与消息的第一个部分，多余的数据将丢失和引发。If the datagram you receive is larger than the size of the `buffer` parameter, `buffer` gets filled with the first part of the message, the excess data is lost and a is thrown. > [!NOTE] > 如果你收到，使用属性来获取特定的错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后，请参阅 Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码文档 MSDN 库中的有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the Windows Sockets version 2 API error code documentation in the MSDN library for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[在.NET Framework 中进行网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例接收在连接上的数据。The following code example receives data on a connected . using . 如果超出了超时值，调用将引发。If the time-out value was exceeded, the call will throw a . 如果你是在非阻塞模式下，并且没有中可用的数据在协议堆栈缓冲区中方法将立即完成并引发。If you are in non-blocking mode, and there is no data available in the in the protocol stack buffer, the method will complete immediately and throw a . 你可以使用属性来确定是否可供读取数据。You can use the property to determine if data is available for reading. 当为非零，重试该接收操作。When is non-zero, retry the receive operation. 如果使用的一个面向连接的、方法将读取多的数据可用，直到达到的缓冲区的大小。If you are using a connection-oriented , the method will read as much data as is available, up to the size of the buffer. 如果远程主机关闭与连接收到方法，并且所有可用数据，方法将立即完成并返回零字节。If the remote host shuts down the connection with the method, and all available data has been received, the method will complete immediately and return zero bytes. 如果你使用的是无连接，将从你在中指定的目标地址中读取第一个排队数据报方法。If you are using a connectionless , will read the first enqueued datagram from the destination address you specify in the method. 如果你收到的数据报大于的大小`buffers`参数，`buffers`被填与消息的第一个部分，多余的数据将丢失和引发。If the datagram you receive is larger than the size of the `buffers` parameter, `buffers` gets filled with the first part of the message, the excess data is lost and a is thrown. > [!NOTE] > 如果你收到，使用属性来获取特定的错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后，请参阅 Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码文档 MSDN remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法将数据读入的缓冲区参数并返回成功读取的字节数。The method reads data into the buffer parameter and returns the number of bytes successfully read. 你可以调用从面向连接的和无连接的套接字。You can call from both connection-oriented and connectionless sockets. 此重载仅要求您提供接收缓冲区和所需。This overload only requires you to provide a receive buffer and the necessary . 缓冲区偏移量的默认值为 0，并且大小默认为字节参数的长度。The buffer offset defaults to 0, and the size defaults to the length of the byte parameter. 如果你使用的一个面向连接的协议，则必须调用建立远程主机的连接，或接受之前调用的传入连接。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, you must either call to establish a remote host connection, or to accept an incoming connection prior to calling . 方法将仅读取数据中建立的远程主机从到达或方法。The method will only read data that arrives from the remote host established in the or method. 如果你使用的是无连接协议，你还可以使用方法。If you are using a connectionless protocol, you can also use the method. 将可以接收来自任何主机的数据。 will allow you to receive data arriving from any host. 如果没有数据可供读取，方法将一直阻止到的数据是否可用。If no data is available for reading, the method will block until data is available. 如果你是在非阻塞模式下，并且没有在协议堆栈缓冲区中可用的数据方法将立即完成并引发。If you are in non-blocking mode, and there is no data available in the protocol stack buffer, the method will complete immediately and throw a . 你可以使用属性来确定是否可供读取数据。You can use the property to determine if data is available for reading. 当为非零，重试你接收操作。When is non-zero, retry your receive operation. 如果使用的一个面向连接的、方法将读取到缓冲区的大小可尽可能数据。If you are using a connection-oriented , the method will read as much data as is available up to the size of the buffer. 如果远程主机关闭与连接收到方法，并且所有可用数据，方法将立即完成并返回零字节。If the remote host shuts down the connection with the method, and all available data has been received, the method will complete immediately and return zero bytes. 如果你使用的是无连接，将从你在中指定的目标地址中读取第一个排队数据报方法。If you are using a connectionless , will read the first enqueued datagram from the destination address you specify in the method. 如果你收到的数据报大于的大小`buffer`参数，`buffer`被填与消息的第一个部分，多余的数据将丢失和引发。If the datagram you receive is larger than the size of the `buffer` parameter, `buffer` gets filled with the first part of the message, the excess data is lost and a is thrown. > [!NOTE] > 如果你收到，使用属性来获取特定的错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后，请参阅 Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码文档 MSDN remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法将数据读入的缓冲区参数并返回成功读取的字节数。The method reads data into the buffer parameter and returns the number of bytes successfully read. 你可以调用从面向连接的和无连接的套接字。You can call from both connection-oriented and connectionless sockets. 如果你使用的一个面向连接的协议，则必须调用建立远程主机的连接，或接受之前调用的传入连接。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, you must either call to establish a remote host connection, or to accept an incoming connection prior to calling . 方法将仅读取数据中建立的远程主机从到达或方法。The method will only read data that arrives from the remote host established in the or method. 如果你使用的是无连接协议，你还可以使用方法。If you are using a connectionless protocol, you can also use the method. 将可以接收来自任何主机的数据。 will allow you to receive data arriving from any host. 如果没有数据可供读取，方法将阻塞，直到数据不可用，除非通过使用设置超时值。If no data is available for reading, the method will block until data is available, unless a time-out value was set by using . 如果超出了超时值，调用将引发。If the time-out value was exceeded, the call will throw a . 如果你是在非阻塞模式下，并且没有中可用的数据在协议堆栈缓冲区中方法将立即完成并引发。If you are in non-blocking mode, and there is no data available in the in the protocol stack buffer, the method will complete immediately and throw a . 尝试访问套接字时出错。An error occurred when attempting to access the socket. 请参阅下面的备注。See Remarks below. 你可以使用属性来确定是否可供读取数据。You can use the property to determine if data is available for reading. 当为非零，重试该接收操作。When is non-zero, retry the receive operation. 如果使用的一个面向连接的、方法将读取原样可用，直到达到指定大小参数的字节数多的数据。If you are using a connection-oriented , the method will read as much data as is available, up to the number of bytes specified by the size parameter. 如果远程主机关闭与连接收到方法，并且所有可用数据，方法将立即完成并返回零字节。If the remote host shuts down the connection with the method, and all available data has been received, the method will complete immediately and return zero bytes. 如果你使用的是无连接，将从你在中指定的目标地址中读取第一个排队数据报方法。If you are using a connectionless , will read the first queued datagram from the destination address you specify in the method. 如果你收到的数据报大于的大小`buffer`参数，`buffer`被填与消息的第一个部分，多余的数据将丢失和引发。If the datagram you receive is larger than the size of the `buffer` parameter, `buffer` gets filled with the first part of the message, the excess data is lost and a is thrown. > [!NOTE] > 如果你收到，使用属性来获取特定的错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后，请参阅 Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码文档 MSDN 库中的有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the Windows Sockets version 2 API error code documentation in the MSDN library for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[在.NET Framework 中进行网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例上连接接收数据之前指定数据缓冲区、 偏移量、 大小和套接字标志。The following code example specifies a data buffer, an offset, a size, and a socket flag before receiving data on a connected . remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法使用套接字或绑定无连接的套接字连接，并且用于读取传入数据。The method is used on connected sockets or bound connectionless sockets and is used to read incoming data. 必须知道套接字的本地地址。The socket's local address must be known. 对于绑定无连接的套接字，此函数将限制从其接受接收的消息的地址。For bound connectionless sockets, this function restricts the addresses from which received messages are accepted. 该函数仅返回从连接中指定的远程地址的消息。The function only returns messages from the remote address specified in the connection. 从其他地址的消息将以无提示方式被丢弃。Messages from other addresses are silently discarded. 属性`e`参数提供关于读取请求的其他信息的窗口套接字服务提供程序。The property on the `e` parameter provides the Window Sockets service provider with additional information about the read request. 有关如何使用此参数的详细信息，请参阅。For more information about how to use this parameter, see . 下列属性和事件上的对象所需成功调用此方法：The following properties and events on the object are required to successfully call this method: - 或 or - 如果设置 if is set - 如果设置 if is set - 调用方可能设置到在调用前要求任何用户状态对象的属性方法，以便在回叫方法可检索信息。The caller may set the property to any user state object desired before calling the method, so that the information will be retrievable in the callback method. 如果回调需要比单个对象的详细信息，可以创建一个小型类来保存作为成员的其他所需的状态信息。If the callback needs more information than a single object, a small class can be created to hold the other required state information as members. 对于字节流样式套接字，传入数据会放入缓冲区中，直到填充了缓冲区，连接将关闭，或用完内部缓冲的数据。For byte stream-style sockets, incoming data is placed into the buffer until the buffer is filled, the connection is closed, or the internally buffered data is exhausted. 对于面向消息的套接字，传入消息会放入缓冲区中直到与关联的缓冲区的总大小`e`参数。For message-oriented sockets, an incoming message is placed into the buffer up to the total size of the buffer associated with the `e` parameter. 如果消息是比的缓冲区大，与消息的第一个部分填充缓冲区。If the message is larger than the buffer, the buffer is filled with the first part of the message. 对于面向连接的套接字，方法可以指示中依赖于套接字为字节流还是面向消息的两种方式之一虚拟线路正常终止。For connection-oriented sockets, the method can indicate the graceful termination of the virtual circuit in one of two ways that depend on whether the socket is byte stream or message oriented. 对于字节流，设置已读零字节指示正常结束，并且将不会读取任何多个字节。For byte streams, zero bytes having been read indicates graceful closure and that no more bytes will ever be read. 对于面向消息的套接字，其中零字节的消息通常是允许的与设置为本机 Winsock WSAEDISCON 错误代码 (10101) 用于指示正常的闭包。For message-oriented sockets, where a zero byte message is often allowable, a with the set to the native Winsock WSAEDISCON error code (10101) is used to indicate graceful closure. 在任何情况下，与错误代码 (10054) 设置为本机 Winsock WSAECONNRESET 指示放弃性关闭已发生。In any case, a with the set to the native Winsock WSAECONNRESET error code (10054) indicates an abortive close has occurred.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 更大的缓冲区大小可能会减少的空确认 （不包含数据部分的 TCP 数据包），但也可能会延迟连接问题的识别。A larger buffer size potentially reduces the number of empty acknowledgements (TCP packets with no data portion), but might also delay the recognition of connection difficulties. 请考虑增加缓冲区大小，如果传输大型文件，或者正在使用的高带宽、 高延迟连接 （如卫星宽带提供程序。）Consider increasing the buffer size if you are transferring large files, or you are using a high bandwidth, high latency connection (such as a satellite broadband provider.) ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何将属性。The following code example demonstrates the use of the property. [!code-cpp[SocketPropertyTester#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SocketPropertyTester/CPP/class1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[SocketPropertyTester#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SocketPropertyTester/CS/class1.cs#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法将数据读入`buffer`参数中，返回的字节数已成功读取，并捕获从其发送数据的远程主机终结点。The method reads data into the `buffer` parameter, returns the number of bytes successfully read, and captures the remote host endpoint from which the data was sent. 此方法很有用，如果你想要从未知的主机或多个主机接收无连接数据报。This method is useful if you intend to receive connectionless datagrams from an unknown host or multiple hosts. 此重载仅要求您提供一个接收`buffer`，和表示远程主机。This overload only requires you to provide a receive `buffer`, and an that represents the remote host. 缓冲区偏移量的默认值为 0。The buffer offset defaults to 0. 大小默认的长度为`buffer`参数和`socketFlags`值默认为。The size defaults to the length of the `buffer` parameter and the `socketFlags` value defaults to . > [!NOTE] > 之前调用，必须显式将绑定本地终结点使用方法。Before calling , you must explicitly bind the to a local endpoint using the method. 如果你不希望这样做，将引发。If you do not, will throw a . 使用无连接协议将读取到本地网络缓冲区接收到第一个排队数据报。With connectionless protocols, will read the first enqueued datagram received into the local network buffer. 如果你收到的数据报大于的大小`buffer`、方法将填充`buffer`尽可能可能，而引发的消息与。If the datagram you receive is larger than the size of `buffer`, the method will fill `buffer` with as much of the message as is possible, and throw a . 如果你使用的不可靠的协议，多余的数据将丢失。If you are using an unreliable protocol, the excess data will be lost. 如果你使用的是可靠的协议对过量数据将保留由服务提供商，你可以通过调用来检索它使用足够大的缓冲区的方法。If you are using a reliable protocol, the excess data will be retained by the service provider and you can retrieve it by calling the method with a large enough buffer. 如果没有数据可供读取，方法将一直阻止到的数据是否可用。If no data is available for reading, the method will block until data is available. 如果你是在非阻塞模式下，并且没有中可用的数据在协议堆栈缓冲区中方法将立即完成并引发。If you are in non-blocking mode, and there is no data available in the in the protocol stack buffer, the method will complete immediately and throw a . 你可以使用属性来确定是否可供读取数据。You can use the property to determine if data is available for reading. 当为非零，重试该接收操作。When is non-zero, retry the receive operation. 尽管适用于无连接协议，你可以使用也是一个面向连接的协议。Although is intended for connectionless protocols, you can use a connection-oriented protocol as well. 如果你选择这样做，你必须首先可以建立远程主机的连接通过调用方法或接受传入的远程主机连接，通过调用方法。If you choose to do so, you must first either establish a remote host connection by calling the method or accept an incoming remote host connection by calling the method. 如果未建立或不接受连接，然后调用方法时，将获取。If you do not establish or accept a connection before calling the method, you will get a . 你还可以建立默认远程主机之前调用无连接协议方法。You can also establish a default remote host for a connectionless protocol prior to calling the method. 在这些情况下，任一方法将忽略`remoteEP`参数和仅接收从连接的数据或默认远程主机。In either of these cases, the method will ignore the `remoteEP` parameter and only receive data from the connected or default remote host. 对于面向连接的套接字，将读取多大小的可用尽可能数据`buffer`。With connection-oriented sockets, will read as much data as is available up to the size of `buffer`. 如果远程主机关闭与连接收到方法，并且所有可用数据，方法将立即完成并返回零字节。If the remote host shuts down the connection with the method, and all available data has been received, the method will complete immediately and return zero bytes. > [!NOTE] > 如果你收到，使用属性来获取特定的错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后，请参阅 Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码文档 MSDN 库中的有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the Windows Sockets version 2 API error code documentation in the MSDN library for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 的中使用需要匹配的中使用。The of the used in needs to match the of remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法将数据读入`buffer`参数中，返回的字节数已成功读取，并捕获从其发送数据的远程主机终结点。The method reads data into the `buffer` parameter, returns the number of bytes successfully read, and captures the remote host endpoint from which the data was sent. 此方法很有用，如果你想要从未知的主机或多个主机接收无连接数据报。This method is useful if you intend to receive connectionless datagrams from an unknown host or multiple hosts. 此重载仅要求你提供接收缓冲区，所需，和表示远程主机。This overload only requires you to provide a receive buffer, the necessary , and an that represents the remote host. 偏移量默认值为 0 和默认大小为缓冲区参数的长度。The offset defaults to 0 and the size defaults to the length of the buffer parameter. > [!NOTE] > 之前调用，必须显式将绑定本地终结点使用方法。Before calling , you must explicitly bind the to a local endpoint using the method. 如果你不希望这样做，将引发。If you do not, will throw a . 使用无连接协议将读取到本地网络缓冲区接收到第一个排队数据报。With connectionless protocols, will read the first enqueued datagram received into the local network buffer. 如果你收到的数据报大于的大小`buffer`、方法将填充`buffer`尽可能可能，而引发的消息与。If the datagram you receive is larger than the size of `buffer`, the method will fill `buffer` with as much of the message as is possible, and throw a . 如果你使用的不可靠的协议，多余的数据将丢失。If you are using an unreliable protocol, the excess data will be lost. 如果你使用的是可靠的协议对过量数据将保留由服务提供商，你可以通过调用来检索它使用足够大的缓冲区的方法。If you are using a reliable protocol, the excess data will be retained by the service provider and you can retrieve it by calling the method with a large enough buffer. 如果没有数据可供读取，方法将一直阻止到的数据是否可用。If no data is available for reading, the method will block until data is available. 如果你是在非阻塞模式下，并且没有中可用的数据在协议堆栈缓冲区中方法将立即完成并引发。If you are in non-blocking mode, and there is no data available in the in the protocol stack buffer, the method will complete immediately and throw a . 你可以使用属性来确定是否可供读取数据。You can use the property to determine if data is available for reading. 当为非零，重试该接收操作。When is non-zero, retry the receive operation. 尽管适用于无连接协议，你可以使用也是一个面向连接的协议。Although is intended for connectionless protocols, you can use a connection-oriented protocol as well. 如果你选择这样做，你必须首先可以建立远程主机的连接通过调用方法或接受传入的远程主机连接，通过调用方法。If you choose to do so, you must first either establish a remote host connection by calling the method or accept an incoming remote host connection by calling the method. 如果未建立或不接受连接，然后调用方法时，将获取。If you do not establish or accept a connection before calling the method, you will get a . 你还可以建立默认远程主机之前调用无连接协议方法。You can also establish a default remote host for a connectionless protocol prior to calling the method. 在这些情况下，任一方法将忽略`remoteEP`参数和仅接收从连接的数据或默认远程主机。In either of these cases, the method will ignore the `remoteEP` parameter and only receive data from the connected or default remote host. 对于面向连接的套接字，将读取多大小的可用尽可能数据`buffer`。With connection-oriented sockets, will read as much data as is available up to the size of `buffer`. 如果远程主机关闭与连接收到方法，并且所有可用数据，方法将立即完成并返回零字节。If the remote host shuts down the connection with the method, and all available data has been Received, the method will complete immediately and return zero bytes. > [!NOTE] > 如果你收到，使用属性来获取特定的错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后，请参阅 Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码文档 MSDN 库中的有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the Windows Sockets version 2 API error code documentation in the MSDN library for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 的中使用需要匹配的中使用。The of the used in needs to match the of the used in . > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[在.NET Framework 中进行网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例从远程主机接收无连接的数据报。The following code example receives a connectionless datagram from a remote host. 传递给方法。 are passed to the method. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法主要用于在无连接的套接字上接收数据。The method is used primarily to receive data on a connectionless socket. 必须知道套接字的本地地址。The socket's local address must be known. 调用方必须设置属性是要接收数据的远程主机。The caller must set the property to the of the remote host from which the data is to be received. 属性`e`参数提供关于读取请求的其他信息的窗口套接字服务提供程序。The property on the `e` parameter provides the Window Sockets service provider with additional information about the read request. 有关如何使用此参数的详细信息，请参阅。For more information about how to use this parameter, see . 下列属性和事件上的对象所需成功调用此方法：The following properties and events on the object are required to successfully call this method: - - - - - 调用方可能设置到在调用前要求任何用户状态对象的属性方法，以便在回叫方法可检索信息。The caller may set the property to any user state object desired before calling the method, so that the information will be retrievable in the callback method. 如果回调需要比单个对象的详细信息，可以创建一个小型类来保存作为成员的其他所需的状态信息。If the callback needs more information than a single object, a small class can be created to hold the other required state information as members. 对于面向消息的套接字，传入消息会放入缓冲区中，直到达到总大小的缓冲区。For message-oriented sockets, an incoming message is placed into the buffer up to the total size of the buffer. 和属性确定在缓冲区中数据的位置和的数据量。The and properties determine where in the buffer the data is placed and the amount of data. 对于字节流 – 样式套接字，传入数据会放入缓冲区中，直到填充了缓冲区，连接将关闭，或用完内部缓冲的数据。For byte stream–style sockets, incoming data is placed into the buffer until the buffer is filled, the connection is closed, or the internally buffered data is exhausted. 和属性确定在缓冲区中数据的位置和的数据量。The and properties determine where in the buffer the data is placed and the amount of data.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法将数据读入`buffer`参数中，返回的字节数已成功读取，并捕获从中已发送数据，以及有关接收的数据包的信息的远程主机终结点。The method reads data into the `buffer` parameter, returns the number of bytes successfully read, and captures the remote host endpoint from which the data was sent, as well as information about the received packet. 方法主要用于接收无连接的套接字上的消息数据。The method is used primarily to receive message data on a connectionless socket. 必须知道套接字的本地地址。The socket's local address must be known. 此方法仅可用于数据报和原始套接字。This method can only be used with datagram and raw sockets. 必须使用套接字类型设置为初始化套接字或之前调用此方法。The socket must be initialized with the socket type set to or before calling this method. 这可以使用构造套接字时。This can be done when the socket is constructed using . 对于面向消息的套接字，传入消息放入`buffer`直到达到总大小中指定的参数`size`参数。For message-oriented sockets, an incoming message is placed into the `buffer` parameter up to the total size specified in the `size` parameter. `offset`参数确定中的何处`buffer`放置数据。The `offset` parameter determines where in the `buffer` the data is placed. 实际数据量放入`buffer`返回方法。The actual amount of data placed into the `buffer` is returned by the method. 方法自动方法设置套接字选项`true`首次调用它的给定。The method automatically method sets the socket option to `true` the first time it is called for a given . 但是，返回对象将只能的数据包到达本地计算机的套接字选项已设置后有效。However, the returned object will only be valid for packets which arrive at the local computer after the socket option has been set. 如果套接字之间发送数据包时它所绑定到的本地终结点 (显式方法或通过某项的隐式， ， ，或方法) 和其第一次调用方法，调用到方法将返回无效为这些数据包的对象。If a socket is sent packets between when it is bound to a local endpoint (explicitly by the method or implicitly by one of the , , , or methods) and its first call to the method, calls to method will return invalid objects for these packets. 若要确保所有对象有效，应用程序应设置套接字选项`true`绑定到本地终结点使用之前方法。To ensure that all objects are valid, an application should set the socket option to `true` before it is bound to a local endpoint using the method. 应用程序可以检查`ipPacketInformation`参数是否需要了解是否使用单播、 多播或广播地址发送数据报。An application can examine the `ipPacketInformation` parameter if it needs to know if the datagram was sent using a unicast, multicast, or broadcast address. > [!NOTE] > 的中使用需要匹配的中使用。The of the used in needs to match the of the used in . > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[在.NET Framework 中进行网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是一个静态方法，确定一个或多个状态实例。 is a static method that determines the status of one or more instances. 你必须将放置到的一个或多个套接字然后才能使用方法。You must place one or more sockets into an before you can use the method. 通过调用检查可读性与作为`checkRead`参数。Check for readability by calling with the as the `checkRead` parameter. 若要检查的可写性套接字，使用`checkWrite`参数。To check your sockets for writability, use the `checkWrite` parameter. 检测错误条件，请使用`checkError`。For detecting error conditions, use `checkError`. 在调用、将填充满足条件这些套接字。After calling , the will be filled with only those sockets that satisfy the conditions. 如果要在侦听状态中，可读意味着调用而不会阻止将会成功。If you are in a listening state, readability means that a call to will succeed without blocking. 如果你已接受连接，则可读意味着数据是可供读取。If you have already accepted the connection, readability means that data is available for reading. 在这些情况下，所有的接收操作而不会阻止将会成功。In these cases, all receive operations will succeed without blocking. 可读性也可指示是否远程已关闭连接关闭; 在这种情况下调用会立即返回，返回零字节。Readability can also indicate whether the remote has shut down the connection; in that case a call to will return immediately, with zero bytes returned. 返回时至少一个感兴趣的套接字 (中的套接字`checkRead`， `checkWrite`，和`checkError`列出) 满足其指定的条件，或`microSeconds`超过参数，不管先满足。 returns when at least one of the sockets of interest (the sockets in the `checkRead`, `checkWrite`, and `checkError` lists) meets its specified criteria, or the `microSeconds` parameter is exceeded, whichever comes first. 设置`microSeconds`为-1 指定无限期超时。Setting `microSeconds` to -1 specifies an infinite time-out. 如果进行到非阻止调用，则可写意味着你已成功连接。If you make a nonblocking call to , writability means that you have connected successfully. 如果你没有建立的连接，则可写意味着所有发送操作而不会阻止将会成功。If you already have a connection established, writability means that all send operations will succeed without blocking. 如果你具有对进行了非阻止调用、`checkerror`参数标识未成功连接的套接字。If you have made a non-blocking call to , the `checkerror` parameter identifies sockets that have not connected successfully. > [!NOTE] > 使用方法如果你只想要确定的单个状态。Use the method if you only want to determine the status of a single . > [!NOTE] > 此方法无法检测到某些类型的连接问题，如网络电缆中断，或远程主机已意外关闭。This method cannot detect certain kinds of connection problems, such as a broken network cable, or that the remote host was shut down ungracefully. 你必须尝试发送或接收数据，以检测这些类型的错误。You must attempt to send or receive data to detect these kinds of errors. > [!NOTE] > 如果你收到，使用属性来获取特定的错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后，请参阅 Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码文档 MSDN 库中的有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the Windows Sockets version 2 API error code documentation in the MSDN library for a detailed description of the error. ## Examples 下面的代码示例使用来确定哪些侦听套接字有一个连接请求。The following code example uses to determine which listening sockets have a connection request. [!code-cpp[Socket_Select#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Socket_Select/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Socket_Select#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Socket_Select/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Socket_Select#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Socket_Select/VB/source.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 以同步方式将数据发送到中指定的远程主机或方法并返回成功发送的字节数。 synchronously sends data to the remote host specified in the or method and returns the number of bytes successfully sent. 可以用于面向连接的和无连接协议。 can be used for both connection-oriented and connectionless protocols. 此重载都需要包含你想要发送的数据的缓冲区。This overload requires a buffer that contains the data you want to send. 的默认值为 0，缓冲区偏移量的默认值为 0，并要将默认值发送到的缓冲区大小的字节数。The value defaults to 0, the buffer offset defaults to 0, and the number of bytes to send defaults to the size of the buffer. 如果你使用的是无连接协议，则必须调用之前调用此方法，或将引发。If you are using a connectionless protocol, you must call before calling this method, or will throw a . 如果你使用的一个面向连接的协议，则必须使用建立远程主机的连接，或者使用以接受传入连接。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, you must either use to establish a remote host connection, or use to accept an incoming connection. 如果你使用的无连接协议和计划将数据发送到若干不同的主机，则应使用方法。If you are using a connectionless protocol and plan to send data to several different hosts, you should use the method. 如果不使用方法，你将必须调用对每个调用之前。If you do not use the method, you will have to call before each call to . 你可以使用甚至已建立默认远程主机使用后。You can use even after you have established a default remote host with . 你还可以更改默认远程主机之前调用通过另一个调用。You can also change the default remote host prior to calling by making another call to . 如果你使用的一种面向连接的协议，将阻止，直到缓冲区中的字节的所有发送时，除非使用设置超时。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, will block until all of the bytes in the buffer are sent, unless a time-out was set by using . 如果超出了超时值，调用将引发。If the time-out value was exceeded, the call will throw a . 在锁定模式下，可能会成功完成，即使它发送的字节数小于缓冲区中。In nonblocking mode, may complete successfully even if it sends less than the number of bytes in the buffer. 它是你的应用程序负责跟踪发送的字节数并重试该操作，直到应用程序发送缓冲区中的字节。It is your application's responsibility to keep track of the number of bytes sent and to retry the operation until the application sends the bytes in the buffer. 此外，还有你发送的数据将立即显示在网络不能保证。There is also no guarantee that the data you send will appear on the network immediately. 若要增加网络效率，基础系统可能会延迟传输，直到收集了大量传出数据。To increase network efficiency, the underlying system may delay transmission until a significant amount of outgoing data is collected. 成功完成后方法意味着基础系统有空间来你的数据的网络发送的缓冲区。A successful completion of the method means that the underlying system has had room to buffer your data for a network send. > [!NOTE] > 如果你收到，使用属性来获取特定的错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后，请参阅 Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码文档 MSDN 库中的有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the Windows Sockets version 2 API error code documentation in the MSDN library for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 成功完成后发送不指示已成功传递数据。The successful completion of a send does not indicate that the data was successfully delivered. 如果没有缓冲区空间以容纳要传输的数据传输系统中可用，除非套接字置于阻止模式下，将阻止发送。If no buffer space is available within the transport system to hold the data to be transmitted, send will block unless the socket has been placed in nonblocking mode. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[在.NET Framework 中进行网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何在连接上的发送数据。The following code example demonstrates sending data on a connected . remarks.format: ## Remarks 以同步方式将数据发送到中建立的远程主机或方法并返回成功发送的字节数。 synchronously sends data to the remote host established in the or method and returns the number of bytes successfully sent. 方法可以用于面向连接的和无连接协议。The method can be used for both connection-oriented and connectionless protocols. 此重载都需要包含你想要发送的数据的缓冲区和的按位组合。This overload requires a buffer that contains the data you want to send and a bitwise combination of . 缓冲区偏移量的默认值为 0，并要将默认值发送到的缓冲区大小的字节数。The buffer offset defaults to 0, and the number of bytes to send defaults to the size of the buffer. 如果指定标记为`socketflags`参数值，则发送的无法路由的数据。If you specify the flag as the `socketflags` parameter value, the data you are sending will not be routed. 如果你使用的是无连接协议，则必须调用之前调用此方法，或将引发。If you are using a connectionless protocol, you must call before calling this method, or will throw a . 如果你使用的一个面向连接的协议，则必须使用建立远程主机的连接，或者使用以接受传入连接。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, you must either use to establish a remote host connection, or use to accept an incoming connection. 如果你使用的无连接协议和计划将数据发送到若干不同的主机，则应使用方法。If you are using a connectionless protocol and plan to send data to several different hosts, you should use the method. 如果不使用方法，你将必须调用方法对每个调用之前。If you do not use the method, you will have to call the method before each call to . 你可以使用甚至已建立默认远程主机使用后。You can use even after you have established a default remote host with . 你还可以更改默认远程主机之前调用通过另一个调用。You can also change the default remote host prior to calling by making another call to . 如果你使用的一种面向连接的协议，将阻止，直到缓冲区中的字节的所有发送时，除非使用设置超时。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, will block until all of the bytes in the buffer are sent, unless a time-out was set by using . 如果超出了超时值，调用将引发。If the time-out value was exceeded, the call will throw a . 在锁定模式下，可能会成功完成，即使它发送的字节数小于缓冲区中。In nonblocking mode, may complete successfully even if it sends less than the number of bytes in the buffer. 它是你的应用程序负责跟踪发送的字节数并重试操作，直到应用程序发送请求的字节数。It is your application's responsibility to keep track of the number of bytes sent and to retry the operation until the application sends the requested number of bytes. 此外，还有你发送的数据将立即显示在网络不能保证。There is also no guarantee that the data you send will appear on the network immediately. 若要增加网络效率，基础系统可能会延迟传输，直到收集了大量传出数据。To increase network efficiency, the underlying system may delay transmission until a significant amount of outgoing data is collected. 成功完成后方法意味着基础系统有空间来你的数据的网络发送的缓冲区。A successful completion of the method means that the underlying system has had room to buffer your data for a network send. > [!NOTE] > 你必须确保你的缓冲区的大小不超过基础服务提供程序的最大的数据包大小。You must ensure that the size of your buffer does not exceed the maximum packet size of the underlying service provider. 如果是这样，将不发送数据报和将引发。If it does, the datagram will not be sent and will throw a . 如果你收到，使用属性来获取特定的错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后，请参阅 Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码文档 MSDN 库中的有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the Windows Sockets version 2 API error code documentation in the MSDN library for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 成功完成后发送不指示已成功传递数据。The successful completion of a send does not indicate that the data was successfully delivered. 如果没有缓冲区空间以容纳要传输的数据传输系统中可用，除非套接字置于阻止模式下，将阻止发送。If no buffer space is available within the transport system to hold the data to be transmitted, send will block unless the socket has been placed in nonblocking mode. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[在.NET Framework 中进行网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see[Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples underlying system has had room to buffer your data for a network send. > [!NOTE] > 你必须确保大小不超过基础服务提供程序的最大的数据包大小。You must ensure that the size does not exceed the maximum packet size of the underlying service provider. 如果是这样，将不发送数据报和将引发。If it does, the datagram will not be sent and will throw a . 如果你收到，使用属性来获取特定的错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后，请参阅 Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码文档 MSDN 库中的有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the Windows Sockets version 2 API error code documentation in the MSDN library for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 成功完成后发送不指示已成功传递数据。The successful completion of a send does not indicate that the data was successfully delivered. 如果没有缓冲区空间以容纳要传输的数据传输系统中可用，除非套接字置于阻止模式下，将阻止发送。If no buffer space is available within the transport system to hold the data to be transmitted, send will block unless the socket has been placed in nonblocking mode. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[在.NET Framework 中进行网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例将发送缓冲区中的数据，并指定为。The following code example sends the data found in buffer, and remarks.format: ## Remarks 此重载都需要至少一个包含你想要发送的数据的缓冲区。This overload requires at least one buffer that contains the data you want to send. 值默认为 0。The value defaults to 0. 如果指定标记为`socketFlags`参数，发送的无法路由的数据。If you specify the flag as the `socketFlags` parameter, the data you are sending will not be routed. 如果你使用的是无连接协议，则必须调用之前调用此方法，或将引发。If you are using a connectionless protocol, you must call before calling this method, or will throw a . 如果你使用的一个面向连接的协议，则必须使用建立远程主机的连接，或者使用以接受传入连接。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, you must either use to establish a remote host connection, or use to accept an incoming connection. 如果你使用的无连接协议和计划将数据发送到若干不同的主机，则应使用方法。If you are using a connectionless protocol and plan to send data to several different hosts, you should use the method. 如果不使用方法，你将必须调用对每个调用之前。If you do not use the method, you will have to call before each call to . 你可以使用甚至已建立默认远程主机使用后。You can use even after you have established a default remote host with . 你还可以更改默认远程主机之前调用通过另一个调用。You can also change the default remote host prior to calling by making another call to . 如果你使用的一种面向连接的协议，将阻止，直到缓冲区中的字节的所有发送时，除非使用设置超时。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, will block until all of the bytes in the buffer are sent, unless a time-out was set by using . 如果超出了超时值，调用将引发。If the time-out value was exceeded, the call will throw a . 在非阻塞模式下，可能会成功完成，即使它发送的字节数小于缓冲区中。In non-blocking mode, may complete successfully even if it sends less than the number of bytes in the buffer. 它是你的应用程序负责跟踪发送的字节数并重试该操作，直到应用程序发送缓冲区中的字节。It is your application's responsibility to keep track of the number of bytes sent and to retry the operation until the application sends the bytes in the buffer. 此外，还有你发送的数据将立即显示在网络不能保证。There is also no guarantee that the data you send will appear on the network immediately. 若要增加网络效率，基础系统可能会延迟传输，直到收集了大量传出数据。To increase network efficiency, the underlying system may delay transmission until a significant amount of outgoing data is collected. 成功完成后方法意味着基础系统有空间来你的数据的网络发送的缓冲区。A successful completion of the method means that the underlying system has had room to buffer your data for a network send. > [!NOTE] > 如果你收到，使用属性来获取特定的错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后，请参阅 Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码文档 MSDN 库中的有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the Windows Sockets version 2 API error code documentation in the MSDN library for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 成功完成后发送不指示已成功传递数据。The successful completion of a send does not indicate that the data was successfully delivered. 如果没有缓冲区空间以容纳要传输的数据传输系统中可用，除非套接字置于阻止模式下，将阻止发送。If no buffer space is available within the transport system to hold the data to be transmitted, send remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法用于从面向连接的套接字上的一个或多个缓冲区写入传出数据。The method is used to write outgoing data from one or more buffers on a connection-oriented socket. 此方法也可用，但是，在已连接操作指定远程主机的无连接套接字上。This method can also be used, however, on connectionless sockets that have specified a remote host on a connect operation. 方法会启动异步发送操作中建立的远程主机， ， ， ， ，或方法。The method starts an asynchronous send operation to the remote host established in the , , , , , or method. 下列属性和事件上的对象所需成功调用此方法：The following properties and events on the object are required to successfully call this method: - 或 or - 如果设置 if is set - 如果设置 if is set - 调用方可能设置到在调用前要求任何用户状态对象的属性方法，以便在回叫方法可检索信息。The caller may set the property to any user state object desired before calling the method, so that the information will be retrievable in the callback method. 如果回调需要比单个对象的详细信息，可以创建一个小型类来保存作为成员的其他所需的状态信息。If the callback needs more information than a single object, a small class can be created to hold the other required state information as members. 方法将引发异常，如果不首先调用， ， ， ，或。The method will throw an exception if you do not first call , , , , or . 调用方法使你能够发送单独的执行线程中的数据。Calling the method gives you the ability to send data within a separate execution thread. 对于面向消息的套接字，不超过基础 Windows 套接字服务提供程序的最大消息大小。For message-oriented sockets, do not exceed the maximum message size of the underlying Windows sockets service provider. 如果数据太长，来以原子方式通过基础服务提供商，传输任何数据和方法抛出异常与设置为本机 Winsock WSAEMSGSIZE 错误代码 (10040)。If the data is too long to pass atomically through the underlying service provider, no data is transmitted and the method throws a with the set to the native Winsock WSAEMSGSIZE error code (10040). 请注意，成功完成方法并不表示已成功传递数据。Note that the successful completion of the method does not indicate that the data was successfully delivered.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此重载将文件发送`fileName`到连接的套接字。This overload sends the file `fileName` to the connected socket. `flags`参数默认为(0)，和`preBuffer`和`postBuffer`参数默认为`null`。The `flags` parameter defaults to (0), and the `preBuffer` and `postBuffer` parameters default to `null`. 如果`fileName`是在本地目录中，则可以标识与只是文件的名称; 否则，必须指定完整路径和文件的名称。If `fileName` is in the local directory, it may be identified with just the name of the file; otherwise, the full path and name of the file must be specified. 通配符 ("...\\\myfile.txt") 和 UNC 共享名 ("\\\\\\\shared 目录\\\myfile.txt") 支持。Wildcards ("..\\\myfile.txt") and UNC share names ("\\\\\\\shared directory\\\myfile.txt") are supported. 如果未找到文件，该异常引发。If the file is not found, the exception is thrown. 此方法使用`TransmitFile`Windows 套接字 2 API 中找到函数。This method uses the `TransmitFile` function found in the Windows Sockets 2 API. 有关详细信息`TransmitFile`函数和其标志，请参阅 MSDN 库中的 Windows 套接字文档。For more information about the `TransmitFile` function and its flags, see the Windows Sockets documentation in the MSDN Library. 以同步方式将文件发送到中指定的远程主机或方法。 synchronously sends a file to the remote host specified in the or method. 可用于同时面向连接的和无连接协议。 can be used for both connection-oriented and for connectionless protocols. 如果你使用的是无连接协议，则必须调用之前调用此方法，否则引发异常。If you are using a connectionless protocol, you must call before calling this method, otherwise throws a exception. 如果你使用的一个面向连接的协议，则必须使用建立远程主机连接或使用以接受传入连接。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, you must either use to establish a remote host connection or use to accept an incoming connection. 如果你使用的一种面向连接的协议，阻止，直到发送文件为止。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, blocks until the file is sent. 在锁定模式下，已发送的整个文件之前，可能会成功完成。In nonblocking mode, may complete successfully before the entire file has been sent. 就你发送的数据将立即显示在网络不能保证。There is no guarantee that the data you send will appear on the network immediately. 若要增加网络效率，基础系统可能会延迟传输，直到收集了大量传出数据。To increase network efficiency, the underlying system may delay transmission until a significant amount of outgoing data is collected. 成功完成后方法意味着基础系统有空间来你的数据的网络发送的缓冲区。A successful completion of the method means that the underlying system has had room to buffer your data for a network send. > [!NOTE] > 如果你收到，使用属性来获取特定的错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后，请参阅 Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码文档 MSDN 库中的有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the Windows Sockets version 2 API error code documentation in the MSDN library for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[在.NET Framework 中进行网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例创建并连接套接字然后将文件发送到远程主机。The following code example creates and connects a socket and then sends a file to the remote host. 文件"test.txt"位于本地计算机的根目录中。The file "test.txt" is located in the root directory of the local machine. 否则为引发。If you are using a connectionless protocol, you must call before calling this method; otherwise throws a . 如果你使用的一个面向连接的协议，则必须使用建立远程主机的连接，或者使用以接受传入连接。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, you must either use to establish a remote host connection, or use to accept an incoming connection. 如果你使用的一种面向连接的协议，一直阻塞，直到发送整个文件。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, blocks until the entire file is sent. 在锁定模式下，已发送的整个文件之前，可能会成功完成。In nonblocking mode, may complete successfully before the entire file has been sent. 就你发送的数据将立即显示在网络不能保证。There is no guarantee that the data you send will appear on the network immediately. 若要增加网络效率，基础系统可能会延迟传输，直到收集了大量传出数据。To increase network efficiency, the underlying system may delay transmission until a significant amount of outgoing data is collected. 成功完成后方法意味着基础系统有空间来你的数据的网络发送的缓冲区。A successful completion of the method means that the underlying system has had room to buffer your data for a network send. > [!NOTE] > 如果你收到，使用属性来获取特定的错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后，请参阅 Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码文档 MSDN 库中的有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the Windows Sockets version 2 API error code documentation in the MSDN library for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[在.NET Framework 中进行网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例创建并连接套接字。The following code example creates and connects a socket. 文件"test.txt"位于本地计算机的根目录中。The file "test.txt" is located in the root directory of the local machine. 在此示例中，我们将创建缓冲区和数据后，并使用该文件将它们发送到远程主机。In this example, we create a prebuffer and postbuffer of data and send them to the remote host with the file. 默认值使用。The default are used. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法用于将集合中的文件或在内存中发送到远程主机的数据缓冲区。The method is used to send a collection of files or in memory data buffers to remote host. 必须已连接到远程主机。The must already be connected to the remote host. 如果的工作目录中的文件的引用，那么可能只是文件的名称以进行标识; 否则，必须指定完整路径和文件的名称。If a references a file in the working directory, it may be identified with just the name of the file; otherwise, the full path and name of the file must be specified. 支持通配符和 UNC 共享名。Wildcards and UNC share names are supported. 如果未找到该文件，引发。If the file is not found, is thrown. 若要在完成时得到通知，必须创建实现的回调方法\ 委托和附加到回调事件。To be notified of completion, you must create a callback method that implements the EventHandler\ delegate and attach the callback to the event. 属性`e`参数提供关于文件传输的其他信息的窗口套接字服务提供程序。The property on the `e` parameter provides the Window Sockets service provider with additional information about the file transfer. 有关如何使用此参数的详细信息，请参阅。For more information about how to use this parameter, see . 下列属性和事件上的对象所需成功调用此方法：The following properties and events on the object are required to successfully call this method: - - 调用方可能设置到在调用前要求任何用户状态对象的属性方法，以便在回叫方法可检索信息。The caller may set the property to any user state object desired before calling the method, so that the information will be retrievable in the callback method. 如果回调需要比单个对象的详细信息，可以创建一个小型类来保存作为成员的其他所需的状态信息。If the callback needs more information than a single object, a small class can be created to hold the other required state information as members. 此方法使用在 Windows 套接字 2 API 中找到 TransmitPackets 函数。This method uses the TransmitPackets function found in the Windows Sockets 2 API. 有关 TransmitPackets 函数和其标志的详细信息，请参阅 MSDN 库中的 Windows 套接字文档。For more information about the TransmitPackets function and its flags, see the Windows Sockets documentation in the MSDN Library. 适用于面向连接的协议，尽管方法也适用于无连接协议，前提是你第一次调用， ，或方法来建立默认远程主机。Although intended for connection-oriented protocols, the method also works for connectionless protocols, provided that you first call the , , or method to establish a default remote host. 使用无连接协议，你还必须确保你的文件的大小不能超过基础服务提供程序的最大的数据包大小。With connectionless protocols, you must also be sure that the size of your file does not exceed the maximum packet size of the underlying service provider. 如果是这样，不会发送数据报和引发异常。If it does, the datagram is not sent and throws a exception. 方法进行了优化根据在其中使用的操作系统。The method is optimized according to the operating system on which it is used. 在 Windows server 版本上获得高性能优化方法。On Windows server editions, the method is optimized for high performance. Windows 客户端版本，方法进行了优化以最小内存和资源利用率。On Windows client editions, the method is optimized for minimum memory and resource utilization. 利用中标记出来属性`e`参数可以提供显著的性能优势。Use of the flag in the property on the `e` parameter can deliver significant performance benefits. 如果线程启动方法调用用于繁重的计算，但可以，虽然不，Apc 可能无法启动。If the thread initiating the method call is being used for heavy computations, it is possible, though unlikely, that APCs could be prevented from launching. 请注意，内核和用户模式 Apc 之间存在的差异。Note that there is a difference between kernel and user-mode APCs. 在线程处于等待状态时，将启动内核 Apc。Kernel APCs launch when a thread is in a wait state. 用户模式 Apc 在线程处于可报警等待状态时启动User-mode APCs launch when a thread is in an alertable wait state

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在此重载中，缓冲区偏移量的默认值为 0，要将默认值发送到的大小的字节数`buffer`参数，与值默认为 0。In this overload, the buffer offset defaults to 0, the number of bytes to send defaults to the size of the `buffer` parameter, and the value defaults to 0. 如果你使用的是无连接协议，不需要建立默认远程主机使用方法之前调用。If you are using a connectionless protocol, you do not need to establish a default remote host with the method prior to calling . 只需执行此操作，如果你想要调用方法。You only need to do this if you intend to call the method. 如果调用方法之前调用、`remoteEP`只为发送操作，参数将覆盖指定的默认远程主机。If you do call the method prior to calling , the `remoteEP` parameter will override the specified default remote host for that send operation only. 你还无需调用方法，因为基础服务提供程序将分配的最合适的本地网络地址和端口号。You are also not required to call the method, because the underlying service provider will assign the most appropriate local network address and port number. 如果你需要确定分配的本地网络地址和端口号，则可以使用属性后的方法已成功完成。If you need to identify the assigned local network address and port number, you can use the property after the method successfully completes. 虽然供无连接协议，但是也适用于面向连接的协议。Although intended for connectionless protocols, also works with connection-oriented protocols. 如果使用的一个面向连接的协议，你首先必须通过调用来建立远程主机连接方法或接受传入的连接请求使用方法。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, you must first establish a remote host connection by calling the method or accept an incoming connection request using the method. 如果未建立或不接受远程主机的连接，将引发。If you do not establish or accept a remote host connection, will throw a . 你还可以建立默认远程主机之前调用无连接协议方法。You can also establish a default remote host for a connectionless protocol prior to calling the method. 在这些情况下，任一将忽略`remoteEP`参数并仅将数据发送到已连接或默认远程主机。In either of these cases, will ignore the `remoteEP` parameter and only send data to the connected or default remote host. 阻止套接字将发送的字节缓冲区中的所有一直阻止。Blocking sockets will block until the all of the bytes in the buffer are sent. 由于非阻止完成立即，它可能不发送的字节数的所有`buffer`。Since a nonblocking completes immediately, it might not send all of the bytes in the `buffer`. 它是你的应用程序负责跟踪发送的字节数并重试操作，直到应用程序发送的字节数的所有`buffer`。It is your application's responsibility to keep track of the number of bytes sent and to retry the operation until the application sends all of the bytes in the `buffer`. 此外，还有你发送的数据将立即显示在网络不能保证。There is also no guarantee that the data you send will appear on the network immediately. 若要增加网络效率，基础系统可能会延迟传输，直到收集了大量传出数据。To increase network efficiency, the underlying system may delay transmission until a significant amount of outgoing data is collected. 成功完成后方法意味着基础系统有空间来你的数据的网络发送的缓冲区。A successful completion of the method means that the underlying system has had room to buffer your data for a network send. 如果在阻止模式下，将无连接协议将阻止，直到发送数据报。If you are using a connectionless protocol in blocking mode, will block until the datagram is sent. 如果你想要将数据发送到广播地址，则必须首先调用方法并设置套接字选项设为。If you want to send data to a broadcast address, you must first call the method and set the socket option to . 你还必须是确保发送的字节数不超过基础服务提供程序的最大的数据包大小。You must also be sure that the number of bytes sent does not exceed the maximum packet size of the underlying service provider. 如果是这样，将不发送数据报和将引发。If it does, the datagram will not be sent and will throw a . > [!NOTE] > 如果你收到，使用属性来获取特定的错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后，请参阅 Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码文档 MSDN 库中的有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the Windows Sockets version 2 API error code documentation in the MSDN library for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[在.NET Framework 中进行网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例将无连接的数据报发送到指定的远程主机。The following code example sends a connectionless datagram to the specified remote host.
